evolve::LSystemIncrementalInterpreter

evolve::LSystemIncrementalInterpreter Class Reference

#include <LSystemIncrementalInterpreter.h>

Inheritance diagram for evolve::LSystemIncrementalInterpreter:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Class designed to incrementally interpret an lsystem, and allow for it to be updated This is so we can update it to respond to environmental changes, like physics.

Used like so: LSystemIncrementalInterpreter( System ); vector<points> getPoints(); [push point data into some other structure (physics?)] start: [get updated point data from some other structure] updatePoints( updated_point_data ) new_points grow( new_points& ); [add new point data into some other structure] goto start

Member Function Documentation

bool LSystemIncrementalInterpreter::getSystem ( string &  interpretedSystem,
System &  system,
bool  printDebug = DO_DEBUG 
) [virtual]

Retrieves the interpretation of the lsystem.

The second version is ok for now, since the System interface requires getSystem to return a string version of the object.

Parameters:
system the system being interpreted (as an object or in string form). Note that in some classes this may be a in parameter, in others, an out. (some implementations may associate themselves with only one particular lsystem e.g. to interpreter it incementally over time). These classes should just return the system they are currently interpreting.

Reimplemented from evolve::LSystemGenericInterpreter.

bool LSystemIncrementalInterpreter::getCopy ( Interpreter *&  interpreter,
bool  printDebug = DO_DEBUG 
) [virtual]

Creates a copy of the current interpreter.

Note that if you pass it a non-null pointer, it will attempt to delete it, if it doesn't point at allocated memory, this will make it seg fault. (This is to encourage you to allocate and/or intitialize your pointers to NULL

Parameters:
interpreter a pointer at a copy of this lSystem (the memory is allocated in this method)

Reimplemented from evolve::LSystemGenericInterpreter.

bool LSystemIncrementalInterpreter::grow ( vector< double > &  newPoint,
unsigned int &  index 
) [virtual]

Interprets one new element in the L-System.

Note that a L-System element does not always generate a new point ("[")

Parameters:
newPoint (out). If grown, the new point added to the interpreted system. This vector is cleared of any elements passed in.
index (out). A unique number associated with this point. (Unique within the context of one instance of this interpreter).

bool LSystemIncrementalInterpreter::prev ( vector< double > &  prev,
unsigned int &  index 
) [virtual]

prev returns the last point created for the current branch.

Note this means if you have p1, [ p2, p3, p4 ], it will return p1 Be careful! Note that the semantics of this mean if you call prev() when it's like this: p1, [ p2, p3, p4 (and cache p4 for later use). And then you run grow until it returns a new point: p1, [ p2, p3, p4 ], p5. You will have run grow twice, and your cached prev() will be two elements behind. So be sure you update your prev before every grow() (if you're just trying to store the last point).

Parameters:
prev the previous point. This vector is cleared of any elements passed in.
index A unique number associated with this point. Same as that returned by the grow() which yielded this point.
